intro: Muiria montana, commonly known as the mountain muiria, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and showy, five-petaled flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or white. Muiria montana thrives in high-altitude environments, often growing in rocky or mountainous terrain. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a hairy texture, contributing to its adaptability in harsh climates.
